channel.title: Authors on Anjie Le 勒安捷
channel.description: Recent content in Authors on Anjie Le 勒安捷

item.description:
Anjie Le majored in mathematics at the University of Cambridge. Her work mainly focuses on applying mathematics to the biomedical world. She has done two projects on breast cancer and one on canine CT scans; two on ultrasound imaging, one on CT and one on Whole Slide Images.

As a person, Anjie has a broad spectrum of interests. Quantum computing and Langlands program are something she was keen on. Philosophy, psychology, economics and criminology are what she enjoys reading about in her spare time. Snowboarding, land surfing, swimming, horse-riding and Taekwondo are what she may do when she wants to exercise. She plays the piano and guitar. She enjoys visiting different places. She has three cats and a dog.

Former CTO of Philips Healthcare, founder of Supersonic, Sonosite and so on.

I was honoured to directly report to Acad Jacques Souquet during my time at E-Sonic Imaging, where he is the Chairman and co-founder. During that time, he shared a lot with me about his vision for the future of medical imaging and population health. He is an important mentor of mine, and has definitely shaped my career goal.

We co-wrote the patent ‘Artificial Intelligence Integrated Diagnostic Platform Device in Ultrasound Modality’, together with a colleague of ours.

He kindly wrote a letter of recommendation for me and authorized its unrestricted use.

Haobo is currently an undergraduate student at the University of Edinburgh. We co-wrote the paper “A new breast cancer diagnosis application based on ResNet50”. His current research interests are robotics and federated learning (which aligns with mine!). Visit his website for more information.

Dr Chris Warner was my Director of Studies at Robinson College, University of Cambridge, during my Mathematical Tripos, as well as supervisor in Vectors and Matrices, Differential Equation, Dynamics and Relativity, Electromagnetism, and so on.

In addition to his academic guidance, Dr Warner was also in charge of my well-being at Cambridge, and his support enabled me to make the most of my studies. I am grateful for his mentorship and guidance, which played a significant role in my academic and personal development.

Taochun Sun is a Ph.D. candidate at Tsinghua University, supervised by Prof. Zhu Liu. His research interests stretch from the urban carbon data inventories to the intersection of the Geo-AI and carbon data applications. Recently he is conducting research concerning the urban inventories of the developing countries, and the global carbon emissions forecasts for various sectors. He has published research papers on Nature Geoscience, Nature Communications and other high-profile journals with the citation more than 1100, has presented the latest research results at the EGU Conference 2023 in the form of oral presentation, and has applied 5 software patents for a series of his research. He likes playing basketball, astronomy, and photography.
